Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: claire s
Reviews.Content: I have just spent four days at this hotel and was very happy with it. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast was excellent but I was most impressed by the hospitable service we received. It is in a good location, within a few minutes walk from Alonso Cano and Rías Rojas metro stations. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from leading a school group of 40 Year 10 pupils on our annual Madrid Trip, using the Hotel NH Breton as our base for the 5-day visit. In the nine months of planning for the trip, I was in email communication with the hotel's manageress Raquel, who made it very clear that she and her team would be only too happy to assist us in our planning and needs. For the whole of our stay, we were made to feel welcome and that it was the hotel's pleasure to host our group. Breakfast was excellent, and all of the individual dietary needs of our pupils were met without any problem whatsoever. The meeting room adjacent to the eating area, which we hired out for the duration of the trip, was always laid out ready for us in the morning and thereafter transformed into a comfortable meeting area for us. The bedrooms were clean and comfortable, all with en suite bath and/or shower, and there was free wi fi in the lobby area, which the pupils enjoyed using. The hotel's location was excellent, a two-minute walk to the Alonso Cano metro station or 5-minute walk to the Rios Rosas metro station. I certainly would not hesitate to use this hotel again, be it for business, pleasure of nex year's school trip (although I'm not sure which of those two categories that falls into!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. A couple of blocks from metro. Affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: In the "low-cost-business-oriented" world, NH is a must if you go to Spain. Given that you will be out of the hotel from early morning until very late, you will not use other services but a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. This is what you get @ NH. Nice breakfast service. Simple but good with a lot of healthy options.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SDUinLondon
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed here for their anniversary and really enjoyed it. I chose it as it is very close to my apartment so was able to inspect it. The only negative thing would be the cost of the breakfast, 15.50 euros per person is far too expensive when a typical breakfast in nearby cafe's is 4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A fine night and all's well in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bleepski
Reviews.Content: Good value, convenient location, comfortable (if compact) and friendly. Would recommend this hotel for both business and vacation. No frills but no problems. Metropolitan family atmosphere in the surrounding streets.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DespoinaThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel! The room was big, bright and clean. The bathroom was ok and clean too, with many amenities. The view was nice, a big yard with pools. Two metro stations are located near the hotel (Rios Rosas and Alonso Cano). We didn't enjoy our beds, because they had rollers and they were moving all the time, although we tried to use breaks. Free wi-fi is available only in lobby, it's only for 30 minutes and the speed was slow. Staff was very friendly and helpful! There are many nice bars in the neighborhood and a Dia market right next to the hotel. Smoking rooms are available!

Reviews.Title: “Normal 3* hotel with good price/quality relationship”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located not far from Nuevos Ministerios transport hub and the Corte Ingles. There is a big variety of restaurants of all kind in walking distance. The front of the hotel gives to a narrow and quiet street. The rooms might look a bit old, but are well maintained, comfortable and with all the necessary amenities. The windows are double so even if there could be some noise from the street it wont be perceptible. The bathroom is wide, the bathroom equipment is modest, but in good condition. The bed was big and comfortable. I would say that this is a normal 3 star hotel with good price/quality relationship. If you need to stay by htis area of Madrid it is definetely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dr John at NH Hotel Breton”
Reviews.Author: transponding
Reviews.Content: Located in a primary residential area of north Madrid, the hotel is quiet and clean although the furnishings are somewhat dated. Few restaurants in the area, although a good neighborhood eatery is located right across the street from the main entrance. Near to center city and two metro stations. A good bargain for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NJ_gardener
Reviews.Content: I was attending a meeting in the area and stayed at NH Breton for 5 nights. I arrived around 11am and they were able to give me my room. Attractively furnished and good bathroom; extremely clean. Quiet location, very close to three metro stops. I walked from the closest stop quite late at night and felt safe. Staff spoke some English and were very polite. The breakfast was expensive for what it was (13 euros)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: CJRedhill
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a weekend in Madrid, staying in the NH Breton Hotel. Located in a quiet, safe feeling district, the hotel was good value for money. It was clean, comfortable and the staff were very friendly. Best of all, there are three metro stations all within a 5-10 min walk. Its only 3 or 4 stops into the centre of the city (takes about 10 mins) and the metro also provides easy access to the airport. Madrid's metro is one of the best underground systems I've travelled on. Its fast, efficient and very affordable (6-7 Euros for a 10 trip ticket). We had a fantastic time in this city. It has a relaxed and very welcoming atmosphere. The only downside was having to come home.....!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, quiet and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDGM
Reviews.Content: NH Breton is a nice and modern hotel in a centric area of the city. It is not located right in the middle of the historic Madrid, but it is only 3-4 metro stations away, and from the hotel you can reach the main metro lines and buses just walking (3 metro stations within 5 minute walk). Even walking to the historic city centre is possible (20 minutes). It is also very convenient for the airport (10 minute walk to the metro line which goes straight to Barajas). The area is quiet and safe, but still has a couple of streets full of good restaurants for tapas and wine, in a very lively atmosphere of local people. The hotel itself is nicely decorated, spotlessly clean and served by very friendly staff. Prices can vary a lot, so I recommend to search for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars plus”
Reviews.Author: DCotrim
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a very nice weekend at this Hotel. And for a 3 stars hotel you dont find this kind of service. First, the location is Ok, not in the centre, but very easy to get there, 10 min time, by metro - Alonso Cano-Line 4 - and - Rios Rosas-Line 1 - two very near Metro stations. The room, was spacious, very clean, and well furnished, the bathroom, clean and shiny, with lots of towels, and hot water! The Breakfast, delicious, Full Continental style, with a Spanish toutch, lots of fresh fruit and Tortilha, I recomend! The personal, was allways very pleasent and helpfull, and I didn't expect so many attention for someone being there just for a night. NH Hotels are good Value for Money, I payed 90€, with taxes and breakfast, its not that cheap, but You will not find this price in any other good Madrid hotels. And if you dont want to get surprised, I recomend it ! I know I will be there again !
